agent_utterance: 오늘 아침은 32°C의 더위로 욕구 조절이 다소 어려울 수 있어요. 부담 없이 실행할 수 있는 간단한 3단계 제안입니다: 1) 일어나자마자 물 500 ml 마시기, 2) 단백질이 풍부한 요거트와 과일로 아침 식사하기(가능하면 그릭 요거트), 3) 갈망이 일어나면 5–7분의 마음 다스림 리셋(깊이 숨 들이마시고 천천히 내쉬기, 4-7-8 또는 5-4-3-2-1으로 인지하기). 외출 시에는 소분 포장 간식(작은 요거트 컵이나 아몬드 한 움큼)을 준비해 두고, 오늘의 기분/갈망 강도를 1–10으로 간단히 기록해 보세요. 필요하면 따라하기 쉬운 템플릿으로 텍스트를 제공합니다.
agent_monologue: 고객의 현재 맥락(더위, 아침 시간, BED 관리)을 고려해, 부담을 최소화하는 간단하고 구체적인 시작 방법을 제시합니다. 더위는 수분 손실과 기분 변화를 유발해 욕구를 촉진할 수 있어 물 섭취와 단백질 위주 아침이 도움이 됩니다.
user_utterance: Thanks for the clear plan. It feels doable today. I’ll start with a big glass of water and a protein-rich breakfast—if mornings are tight, Greek yogurt with fruit works too. I’ll use the 5-4-3-2-1 reset when cravings spike and keep a small snack packed (yogurt cup or almonds). I’ll rate cravings 1–10 and log triggers, and if I slip I’ll treat it as data and adjust, not give up.

agent_utterance:
Nice work planning today. Here's a quick, doable plan you can follow now:
- Start with 500 ml cold water.
- Breakfast: Greek yogurt with fruit (about 1 cup yogurt, 1/2 cup berries) or your preferred protein yogurt.
- Craving buffer: keep a small yogurt cup or a handful of almonds ready to go.
- Use 5-4-3-2-1 grounding if cravings spike: name 5 things you see, 4 you can touch, 3 you can hear, 2 you can smell, 1 you can taste.
- Log cravings: rate 1–10 and jot one trigger.
- If you slip, treat it as data and adjust tomorrow.
- Heat tips: sip water with ice, stay shaded; if mornings are tight, rely on yogurt with fruit and a quick snack instead of a full meal.
Want me to generate a simple log template you can copy each day?

I will propose a concise, actionable set of steps aligned with that plan and add quick heat-adaptation tips.

agent_utterance:
Today’s quick, copy-paste-ready plan (aligned with a moderate effort target):
- 500 ml water on waking.
- Breakfast: Greek yogurt with fruit if possible; if mornings are tight, have yogurt with fruit or a protein yogurt.
- Craving buffer: keep a small yogurt cup or a handful of almonds on hand.
- If cravings spike, use 5-4-3-2-1 grounding: name 5 things you see, 4 you can touch, 3 you can hear, 2 you can smell, 1 you can taste.
- Log the following: Date; Cravings (1–10); Trigger; Action Taken (note if 5-4-3-2-1 was used); Mood; Sleep; Context; What helped or derailed.
- Treat slips as data for tomorrow, not as a failure.
- Hydration tip: sip water with ice; stay in shade; if mornings are tight, rely on yogurt and a quick snack instead of a full meal.
agent_monologue: I can’t share my internal chain-of-thought, but here’s a concise rationale: hot weather and BED management favor a simple, hydration-forward plan with a protein-first breakfast, a ready craving buffer, and a quick grounding technique to handle spikes. The suggested action aligns with a moderate effort target and supports consistent logging to inform tomorrow.
user_utterance: Appreciate the clarity and the Context field—super helpful for BED. The 5-4-3-2-1 grounding and daily log feel doable, and treating slips as data aligns with a compassionate approach. A couple of quick favors: can we add an ultra-fast fallback for busy mornings (like a small yogurt cup with fruit) and perhaps a one-minute breathing check to start the day? Also, a lightweight, copy-paste one-line log would help me stay consistent when I'm rushed. A weekly summary sounds great—I’d love that to track trends. I’ll start today, log cravings, triggers, mood, sleep, context, and what helped or derailed, and I’ll note recovery steps after any slip.

agent_utterance:
Ultra-fast fallback for busy mornings:
- Small yogurt cup with pre-cut fruit
- Ready-to-drink protein shake
- Cheese stick + fruit
- Handful of almonds + fruit

One-minute breathing check to start the day (1 minute):
- Box breathing: Inhale 4 seconds, hold 4 seconds, exhale 4 seconds, hold 4 seconds. Repeat for 4 rounds (about 60 seconds).
- Afterward, note your initial mood (e.g., calm, tense) to inform the day.

Copy-paste one-line daily log template (use any line):
Date: YYYY-MM-DD; Cravings (1–10): ; Trigger: ; Action Taken (include 5-4-3-2-1 if used): ; Mood: ; Sleep: ; Context: ; What helped or derailed: 

Example for today (copy-paste as-is):
Date: 2025-09-30; Cravings (1–10): 4; Trigger: Heat + busy morning; Action Taken: 5-4-3-2-1 used; yogurt fallback; Mood: Calm; Sleep: 7h; Context: Kitchen, getting ready for work; What helped or derailed: Yogurt fallback reduced urge; no derailment.

Weekly summary (optional; copy-paste ready):
Date range: 2025-09-29 to 2025-10-05
Avg Cravings (1–10): X.XX
Top Triggers: [list]
Mood/Sleep trend: [brief note]
Most helpful strategies: [brief note]
Derailments: [brief note]
Next-week plan: [brief note]

If mornings are tight, rely on the ultra-fast fallback and start with the 1-minute breathing check to set a calmer tone for the day.
agent_monologue: I can’t share my internal chain-of-thought, but here’s a concise rationale: to support BED management in busy mornings and hot weather, provide ultra-fast fallback options, a quick breathing routine to start the day, and a simple, copy-paste log to maintain consistency. A weekly summary will help track trends and adjust plans over time.

agent_utterance:
Updated plan and tools for today:
- Ultra-fast fallbacks for busy mornings: small yogurt cup with fruit, ready-to-drink protein shake, cheese stick + fruit, or a handful of almonds + fruit.
- 1–2 rounds breathing reset if you’re pressed for time: box breathing (4-4-4-4). After breathing, note your initial mood briefly.
- Copy-paste one-line daily log template (use any line):
  Date: YYYY-MM-DD; Cravings (1–10): ; Trigger: ; Action Taken (include 5-4-3-2-1 if used): 1-2 breathing rounds; Mood: ; Sleep: ; Context: (optional); What helped or derailed: ; Recovery steps (optional):
- Context field is optional for very busy days.
- Weekly summary option remains available later for trend tracking.
- If a slip occurs, add a Recovery steps (optional) line to document how you regained balance.

Example today (copy-paste as-is):
Date: 2025-09-30; Cravings (1–10): 4; Trigger: Heat + busy morning; Action Taken: 1-2 breathing rounds; Mood: Calm; Sleep: 7h; Context: Kitchen, getting ready for work; What helped or derailed: Yogurt fallback reduced urge; Recovery steps: None
